channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - HP Hero
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: The senator says he was distressed after issues with the first 2020 caucus
item.description: • Full Iowa caucuses results • DNC chair calls for a recanvass in Iowa • Opinion: NH primary is still up for grabs • Prank callers and internet trolls sought to sow chaos on Iowa caucus night

item.title: Bernie Sanders on health care: 'I can't do it alone'
item.description: The first canvasser, for Elizabeth Warren, knocked on my door last June. It was far earlier than in prior years, but like other New Hampshire voters I have been answering the door (or not, depending on my mood), throwing candidate mailers away (Tom Steyer sends at least one a week) and having my Pandora playlist interrupted by Pete Buttigieg for months.

item.title: Full Iowa caucus results
Clinton doubles down on Sanders criticism before townhall
item.description: Former Democratic presidential nominee Hillary Clinton furthered her comments discrediting Sen. Bernie Sanders as a viable presidential candidate on Thursday, insinuating that his potential failure to "deliver the moon" would detract from efforts to rebuild public trust.

item.title: Prank callers and internet trolls sought to sow chaos in Iowa
item.description: Supporters of President Donald Trump worsened this week's Iowa caucus breakdown by placing prank phone calls that hindered the reporting of results, the Iowa Democratic Party said on Thursday.

item.title: Opinion: Democrats whine while Republicans govern
item.description: The remarkable resiliency of President Donald Trump will pay dividends for his Republican Party, as it further unifies behind him in the wake of impeachment and ahead of what is sure to be a savage reelection campaign.

item.title: Yang campaign fires staffers in wake of poor Iowa showing
item.description: Entrepreneur Andrew Yang's campaign fired staffers in the wake of a poor finish in the Iowa caucuses, multiple campaign aides told CNN on Thursday.

item.title: Guilty vote topples Mitt Romney's old image
item.description: • Analysis: Mitt Romney is now the head of the new old GOP • Vitriol at Trump's victory lap • DC waits for Bolton to break his silence • Pro-Trump groups flood social media with videos like this

item.title: CNN debunks Trump's claim about Ivanka during speech
item.description: • Read: Trump attacks impeachment in remarks after acquittal

item.title: White House announces death of terror leader Qassim al-Rimi
item.description: The White House announced Thursday evening that Qassim al-Rimi, the leader of terror group al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula, was killed in an airstrike in Yemen.

item.title: A man mistakenly kills neighbor with a crossbow while trying to save him from a dog
item.description: A Massachusetts man attempting to save his neighbor from a dog attack accidentally shot and killed him with a crossbow, officials said.

item.title: Schiff calls Bolton's decision inexplicable
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper talks with House impeachment managers from President Trump's impeachment trial in an exclusive interview airing Friday night at 8p ET.

item.title: Weinstein defense calls first witness: friend says he has a "sex addiction"
item.description: Harvey Weinstein's defense team called their first witness Thursday -- a former producer who they say casts doubt on actress Annabella Sciorra's alleged rape allegations.

item.title: Gayle King criticizes CBS for sharing 'salacious' clip of Lisa Leslie defending Kobe
item.description: Gayle King has criticized her employer CBS for sharing a "salacious" and "out of context" clip of her questioning basketball icon Lisa Leslie about allegations leveled against the late Kobe Bryant.

item.title: Disney apologizes to school that was charged $250 for showing 'The Lion King'
item.description: Disney CEO Bob Iger has apologized to a California elementary school after it was charged $250 for showing the studio's 2019 remake of "The Lion King" during a fundraiser event.

item.title: Teenager was shot dead while rapping on Facebook Live
item.description: A teenager was shot and killed while on Facebook Live, near his home in New York on Tuesday and now police are looking for whoever is responsible.

item.title: Gymnast shamed over video of daughter
item.description: Olympic gymnast and gold medalist Shawn Johnson receives backlash over a video she posted of her 3-month-old daughter. HLN's Melissa Knowles and Lynn Smith discuss mom-shaming.

item.title: College coach resigns after allegedly using a racial epithet around athletes
item.description: Erik Helland, the University of Wisconsin-Madison's longtime strength and conditioning coach for the men's basketball team, has resigned from the program.

item.title: Walmart shooting supspect is now facing federal hate crime charges
item.description: The man accused of killing 22 people and injuring nearly two dozen more in a mass shooting at a Walmart store in El Paso, Texas, has been indicted on 90 federal charges, including hate crimes, court documents show.

item.title: Rep. Jim Jordan chosen as top Republican on House Judiciary Committee
item.description: Rep. Jim Jordan of Ohio has been selected as the next ranking Republican on the House Judiciary Committee by the House Republican steering committee, a GOP source tells CNN.

item.title: CNN's Brooke Baldwin: These words came from Medal of Freedom recipient
item.description: CNN's Brooke Baldwin reacts to President Donald Trump's decision to award Rush Limbaugh, conservative radio host, with the Medal of Freedom-- the highest honor a civilian can receive.

item.title: Pablo Escobar's chief hitman 'Popeye' dies of cancer
item.description: A man who had oversight over a web of assassins working for the infamous drug trafficker Pablo Escobar is dead.

item.title: A Florida trooper stopped to help a motorist with a broken-down car. The man killed him
Room gasps at parent's remark during school meeting about racism
item.description: A community meeting, meant to promote diversity at Saline Area Schools in Michigan, ended in tension after a parent was heckled while describing his children's experiences

item.title: Kobe Bryant memorial service to be held February 24 at Staples Center, source says
item.description: A memorial service for Kobe Bryant and the other eight people killed in a January helicopter crash will be held at the Staples Center in Los Angeles on February 24, a source close to the basketball legend's family said Thursday.

item.title: SpaceX considering spin-off and IPO for Starlink internet business
item.description: SpaceX's Starlink internet business could one day be spun off into a separate company and taken public, giving mainstream investors a chance to buy a coveted piece of Elon Musk's rocket venture.

item.title: TV comedians mock Trump's acquittal
item.description: Late-night hosts react to the Senate's acquittal of President Donald Trump and Sen. Mitt Romney (R-UT) breaking with the GOP to be the lone Republican to vote to convict Trump on one of the impeachment counts.

item.title: Analysis: Why Shannen Doherty's cancer diagnosis feels personal to many in Gen X
item.description: Shannen Doherty and I graduated high school the same year, even though hers was the fictional West Beverly High and mine was in New York. We've never met, but she's someone I greatly admire and feels like a friend. So I found myself in tears on Tuesday when I read Doherty's breast cancer had returned after a remission.

item.title: Pelosi gets nickname after tearing up speech
item.description: Critics shred "Nancy the Ripper" while fans say let her rip. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports on the torn up speech.

item.title: What it was like to flee China on a charter plane bound for the US
item.description: When a taxi driver showed up to pick up Priscilla Dickey and her 8-year-old daughter from their home in Wuhan, China, the epicenter the outbreak of the coronavirus, he wore a blue hazmat suit.

item.title: Virus has spread to over 25 countries and territories outside China
Wuhan hospital announces death of whistleblower doctor after confusion in state media
item.description: Li Wenliang, the Chinese whistleblower doctor who warned the public of a potential "SARS-like" disease in December 2019, has died, according to Wuhan Central Hospital. The confirmation follows a series of conflicting statements about his condition from the hospital and Chinese state media outlets.

item.title: US honeymooners are stuck on cruise ship
item.description: When American newlyweds Milena Basso and Gaetano Cerullo set out for their honeymoon, it should have been the trip of a lifetime.

item.title: Stunning timelapse of hospital built in just days
item.description: The first of Wuhan's two new medical facilities dedicated to coronavirus patients has been completed, after more than 1,000 workers and 100 machines worked non-stop for days.

item.title: All the Apple deals you can shop now on Amazon
35 thoughtful Valentine's Day gifts she'll love
The best smartwatches in 2020
These 5-star gifts on Amazon are perfect for Valentine's Day
Nick Gordon, the former boyfriend of Bobbi Kristina Brown, died from a heroin overdose
item.description: Nick Gordon, the former boyfriend of Bobbi Kristina Brown, died from a heroin overdose, according to Florida's Districts 5 & 24 medical examiner's office.

item.title: US clears way for self-driving vehicle with no steering wheel or pedals
item.description: The federal government has cleared the way for a Silicon Valley startup to deploy thousands of its self-driving delivery vehicles on US streets.

item.title: Coach lets team manager play. See his shot that made crowd go wild
item.description: 18-year-old Daniel Lucke, manager for a high school basketball team in Georgia, made a movie-worthy shot when he was put in on Senior Night.

item.title: A property that once belonged to a family of serial killers goes up for sale
How Trump's three years of job gains compares to Obama's
item.description: President Donald Trump says he is particularly pleased with the jobs created during his three years in office.

item.title: The agony and ecstasy of being forced to give up our phones at Broadway shows and concerts
item.description: Perhaps the one great equalizer left in the world is when everyone in an audience, Anna Wintour included, is forced to hand over their phones and pretend to be okay with that for 90 minutes of theater.

item.title: Southwest is giving its employees 6 weeks of extra pay
item.description: Southwest Airlines had a particularly rough 2019, but it still managed to turn a profit. As part of an annual tradition, Southwest is sharing that profit with employees.

item.title: A spiteful Trump makes us all less safe
item.description: Ninety seconds. That's my record for getting through border controls at John F. Kennedy International Airport, armed with my Global Entry card. Customs took an additional two minutes (Global Entry card holders have their own line). This streamlined processing by the Trusted Traveler program allowed me to plan same-day business, rather than spend hours in line.

item.title: Honoring Limbaugh was outrageous
item.description: There is no question that Rush Limbaugh is a man of immense talent, wit and on-air charisma.

item.title: The Oscars' 'Harriet Tubman problem'
item.description: Joaquin Phoenix's impassioned BAFTA acceptance speech, in which he criticized the lack of diversity in filmmaking, showed the persistence of structural racism. Phoenix implicated himself before an overwhelmingly white, and largely stunned, audience -- and cast a strong spotlight on the lack of racial diversity in the nominations for this weekend's Academy Awards.

item.title: Acquittal is not exoneration
item.description: Despite the Trump White House's insistence that the President has been vindicated and exonerated by the Senate vote to not remove him from office, acquittal does not mean exoneration in an impeachment trial.

item.title: The only thing Trump learned from impeachment
item.description: A few thoughts on impeachment.

item.title: After 'American Dirt,' can I call myself Latinx?
item.description: My mother is Puerto Rican, my father is Irish. I'm not fluent in Spanish and I look white. My ethnic background is close to Jeanine Cummins, the author of the novel "American Dirt." Do people like me -- or Cummins -- have the right to call ourselves Latinx?

item.title: Hack your mortgage by refinancing to a 15yr fixed
9 cards charging 0% interest until 2021
Apple's $7 trillion bet
Scottish finance secretary quits over alleged messages to teenage boy
item.description: Scotland's Finance Secretary Derek Mackay resigned on Thursday over a report in Scottish media that he had been sending hundreds of messages to a 16-year-old boy.

item.title: Will the new coronavirus burn out like SARS ... or is it here to stay?
item.description: Nearly two decades after he was treated, former severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) patient Alex Lam is still haunted by his experience.

item.title: Girl raped on grounds of US embassy in New Delhi
item.description: A man has been arrested for allegedly raping a five-year-old girl on the grounds of the US embassy in New Delhi, according to police.

item.title: CNN journalists living and working under coronavirus quarantine
item.description: CNN's David Culver chronicles his team's time under quarantine in Beijing after reporting from Wuhan, China, the epicenter of the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: High-speed train derails in Italy leaving two dead and several injured
item.description: Two people died and dozens were injured after a high-speed train derailed in Italy's Lodi province early on Thursday morning, Italian authorities said.

item.title: Customs and Border Protection now considered a 'security agency' just like FBI
item.description: US Customs and Border Protection is now considered a "security agency," a move that allows the agency to shield information about personnel from the public.

item.title: California may stop school fitness tests over fears they lead to bullying and body-shaming
item.description: Push-ups, curl-ups and the dreaded one-mile run are a staple of childhood in US schools. But California may put a stop to the tests.

item.title: Madoff says he's dying and wants out of prison
item.description: Bernard Madoff says he is dying and is asking a judge for compassionate release from prison, where he is serving 150 years for orchestrating the largest Ponzi scheme in history, according to a Wednesday federal court filing.

item.title: Man pleads guilty to killing a woman and dumping her body in Connecticut woods, officials say
WaPo: Trump admin 'finalized' drilling plans on land formerly part of Utah monuments
item.description: The Trump administration on Thursday "finalized" plans to expand "drilling, mining and grazing" on land in Utah that used to be part of the Grand-Staircase Escalante National Monument and the Bears Ears National Monument, The Washington Post reported.

item.title: Where to eat in New York, according to its top models
item.description: For models, there's more to fashion week than walking a runway or two. Days start in the early hours, with multiple castings, fittings and shows to cram into 24 hours; naturally, they need to keep well fueled. CNN asked four models where they like to eat in New York during fashion week, as well as how they spend their spare time in the city -- if they have any.

item.title: Why J-Lo is more powerful than ever
item.description: When Jennifer Lopez performs at the Superbowl halftime show with Shakira on Sunday night in Miami, we'll be sure to witness an epic performance. After all, when J-Lo performs -- whether she's on stage, on camera, or storming a runway -- all heads turn.

item.title: Cats and Kardashians: How fashion embraced memes
item.description: The fashion industry -- with its close relationship to celebrity and pop culture -- finds itself at home in the world of online memes.

item.title: How 'feng shui' may help shape Africa's future cities
item.description: When architect Mphethi Morojele began designing Freedom Park in Pretoria, South Africa, a 130-acre (52-hectare) memorial to lives lost in the struggle against the country's Apartheid regime, he took the unconventional step of handing over the plans to a group of spiritual healers.

item.title: 7 paintings that show why Picasso was a master
item.description: It's hard to imagine a visual record of the 20th century without Pablo Ruiz Picasso. With his bold shapes and characteristic angles, the Spanish artist captured everything from the horrors of war to the boundless possibilities of the human form.
